intro: Fagara thomensis, commonly known as the Toménsis soursop, is a member of the Rutaceae family native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree characterized by its smooth, grayish-brown bark and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces fragrant, white flowers that are followed by green, inedible berries. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and the presence of oil glands on its leaves and stems. Fagara thomensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats within rainforests.
